intro: Schmidelia integerrima, commonly known as the silky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple. Schmidelia integerrima is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
